text: what's up you guys this one's all about gme because it's kind of quiet out there so should be a relatively quick video just keeping the Cadence up taking a look at what's happening on a daily basis here so what did we see today well ended at 2550 up 1.11 on the day and we are in this consolidation section in here you could tell it is about as narrow as you can get we're range bound between 2570 and to the downside on the closes opens 2475 so like a buck we are just below the point of control and all this means to me is that a lot of people are still willing to transact here there's a lot of both buying and selling when we look at the overall average volume though it's pretty quiet it's below the 1 month average VA today has been the quietest it's been since it looks like looks like pre squeeze this might be close what was the volume here 9.5 to 7.7 yeah so this is the quietest been essentially since we saw this uh pop way back here in the beginning or in the middle of May I should say so quiet day out there moving averages are all starting to look flat and yeah I mean for me the way I'm looking at it right now I have no options out on the position and that's just because it's not really moving a whole lot but I

text: should say so quiet day out there moving averages are all starting to look flat and yeah I mean for me the way I'm looking at it right now I have no options out on the position and that's just because it's not really moving a whole lot but I do have shares on the position I actually just added some more shares the primary reason for that is just complimenting a little bit of the broader portfolio and specifically with this position I do have some short options out against it 90 days out for a couple different reasons but it's mostly to provide a bit of a short-term Tailwind in case we do get a pullback so this is not so much is so some sort of theta Decay play it's definitely much more of a downside hedge if needed and it guarantees a decent profit with where we're at right now but those will be managed more likely than not on either a pullback or they'll be moved out as we get closer in time so typically when I'm selling options especially like short calls against long Deltas whether it's long calls or long shares I like to be a little bit closer in time but I'm planning on playing both of these expiration Cycles when I start to see just a little bit more movement so that's why I'm moving these further out it fits the broader picture just a little bit better now overall volume

text: side again very very quiet all across the board now if we add quickly the put side in drop these calls out super quiet all below 100,000 and then on the purchase side also all below 100,000 so what I'm highlighting is we are coming into a bit of a quiet period it would seem and with something like GameStop you never know if it's actually quiet or if it's temporary quiet about to get real loud we do not know and I do think now's an interesting time to start looking at the positions that you have make sure that you have the exposure you want because a lot of times you can see something in here and you're like man it looks kind of boring and sometimes that's a good time to reconfigure your exposure because if you start trying to get long when things are up here it's much more difficult and your risk is much higher whereas if you're adjusting when we're down just hovering in these really Consolidated levels it's a little bit of a different story I set a bunch of different stops for me to phase out of my positions that's essentially what all these different alerts are to get me out when I don't want to hold when things aren't moving my Direction so take a look at what you got and as always if you have any questions or anything you want me to take a look at let me know
